message: I believe that town halls are one of the most important parts of my job because they allow me to speak to and hear from the wonderful constituents of Minnesota’s Sixth District. That is why during the 114th Congress, I hosted 24 town halls throughout the district in my first 24 months in office. Check out my latest blog post to learn all about my town halls and more about why I think they are crucial!
In my first speech of the 115th Congress, I thanked the men and women who bravely serve our nation.

Today I took to the House Floor to discuss the problem of excessive government. For the past eight years, opportunity in America has been under attack by regulations and unelected regulators from Washington. If every American is to have the ability to pursue the American dream, this must end. To learn more, watch my speech below.
#TBT to when I was first sworn in as a Member of Congress. Glad none of mine dabbed.

The 115th Congress is officially underway, and the first week was a success. Be sure to sign up for my weekly newsletter to learn all about the start of the new Congress and to keep up to date with our activities this year!

Like all of you, I myself have a lot of expectations for what needs be accomplished over the next few years. The American people spoke on Election Day and made it clear that they want things to change. So that is our mandate. To learn more about the top items on the legislative agenda, check out my Ask Tom video below.

Today, on National Law Enforcement Day, I ask that you all take a moment to appreciate the men and women, whose job it is to protect our communities each and every day. Minnesota is home to many phenomenal law enforcement officers, who at times put their lives on the line to ensure our safety and security. Their jobs are not easy, but they are incredibly important, so make sure to thank a law enforcement officer today!

On Sunday, I attended a deployment ceremony for the members of the Minnesota Air Force Reserves 934th Airlift Wing. While watching these brave men and women saying their final goodbyes to their families, I was again reminded of the great sacrifice made by those in our nation’s armed forces. This is a sacrifice that we must never take for granted, and I can’t thank these individuals enough for their brave service.

Are you having difficulty navigating a federal agency? If so, never fear! My staff will be holding mobile office hours once again to assist you with any troubles that you might be having. Be sure to stop by mobile office hours tomorrow at the Watertown City Hall from 9:30 to 11:30am! If you can’t make it, then visit https://emmer.house.gov/about/events to find an upcoming event that will be more convenient for you!
On Law Enforcement Appreciation Day, I am displaying this blue light to honor all the courageous individuals who protect us each and every day.
Hard to believe that today my eldest son and my namesake turns 27! Tripp, I love you and wish you the happiest of birthdays!

Today I am proud to support the Regulatory Accountability Act, which will decrease the burdensome regulations created by unelected bureaucrats. To learn more about the regulations that have been strangling small businesses and American families for the past eight years, check out the link below.

Small businesses are a huge driver of our state, but running one is no easy task. That is why I thanked three of the best businesses in Elk River for their contributions to our community and Minnesota as whole.

An exciting aspect of the start of a new Congress is that we have the opportunity to change offices. I am proud to announce that my D.C. office is now located in 315 Cannon House Office Building, and in a fortunate twist, my office has an interesting bit of history behind it. To learn about the history behind my office, check out my Ask Tom video below where I give a tour of 315 Cannon.

Today we must pause to remember the life and legacy of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. He remained courageous in the face of tremendous adversity so that we may all live in a better nation. He inspired us all and we will never forget the lessons he taught us.
Check out my video below to learn about why I am excited to spend Inauguration week here in our nation’s Capital!
Minnesota is the greatest state in the country and bringing the World’s Fair to Minnesota would be the perfect way to showcase the businesses, people and natural beauty that our state has to offer.

Today I had students from Cathedral High School in St. Cloud join me in my new Washington D.C. office to discuss the value of civic engagement and the future of government. It was inspiring to speak to such an intelligent and interested group of kids. Our children are the future of this nation, and after meeting these students, I am reminded that the future is very bright!
I reintroduced legislation to make America competitive again. Learn more below.
My open house to welcome inauguration guests is getting started. Please stop by 315 Cannon House Office Building if you are in town!
Thanks to everyone who stopped by my open house today! Glad to have the chance to talk to Minnesotans and even break out the selfie stick!

Today, the world watched President Trump expound upon his hopes for the future of this nation. I agree with President Trump that, ‘when America is united, America is totally unstoppable’ and after hearing his message today, I am even more optimistic about our path forward. I am looking forward to working with President Trump and the 115th Congress to make our hopes and dreams – and those of millions of Americans - a reality.
Today is Hockey Day Minnesota, one of my favorite days! It’s only fitting to share some stories from my nearly 50 years of playing hockey.

We will be accomplishing a lot during the 115th Congress, so I encourage everyone to join me at my first town hall of the year in Stearns County on February 22 to hear all about our plans. But more importantly, I would like to hear from you and learn all about what you would like to see achieved over the next two years!
Jacquie and I join all Minnesotans in sending prayers to Governor Mark Dayton. I know firsthand that he's a fighter and will face this disease head on.

I am incredibly excited to learn about President Trump’s actions today to advance the energy interests of this nation through his move to advance the Keystone XL and Dakota Access pipelines. Click below to learn more.
Today I was proud to speak on the House Floor to remember the life of Dick Bernick, and his incredible legacy of generosity.

This week is School Choice Week, so I want to highlight the importance of school choice in Minnesota and across our nation. I am the proud father of seven beautiful children, and I know that their mother and I are better suited than Washington bureaucrats in deciding what type of education they receive. Education should not be a one size fits all system, and I strongly believe that parents should decide what type of public, private, magnet, charter, religious, or home school that best fits their child’s needs.
Today is the first day of the St. Paul Winter Carnival so I wanted to share a #TBT of my beautiful wife Jacquie when she was crowned Queen of Snows at the carnival!

Thank you to everyone who joined the March for Life yesterday! As Vice President Pence said "life is winning again in America!" I am committed to working with President Trump and my colleagues in the 115th Congress to defend life.

This morning, I was honored to join a deployment ceremony for the 257th Military Police Company. Proud to stand among so many courageous men and women in uniform. Thank you for your service and praying for a quick and safe return!

This week I signed a letter supporting the removal of IRS Commissioner John Koskinen. The IRS, under Koskinen’s poor leadership, has lost the trust of the American people which is why I believe the time has come to relieve him of his duties. To view the letter, click the link below.

The Affordable Care Act has had a horrible impact on Minnesota, causing many our hardworking residents to suffer. That’s why, this week, Representative Jason Lewis and I sent a letter to President Trump asking for an extension of the current MNSure enrollment deadline so that Minnesotans will have a chance to benefit from the relief provided by the state, and give ample time to evaluate and purchase health insurance for 2017. View our letter below.
This week, the President and Congress worked towards rolling back excessive regulations. Learn more by watching my Ask Tom video below.
Pleased to see President Trump take steps to grant American consumers & financial institutions much needed regulatory relief.
Wishing a happy 18th birthday to my son Billy! Your mother and I are so proud of the young man you’ve become, and we cannot wait to see what your future holds!

Last Friday, President Trump signed two executive orders related to the financial services industry. Due to many Minnesotans wanting to hear more about why I support these executive orders, I wanted to use this week’s video to go more into depth. Check out my video below.

The Email Privacy Act will uphold the 4th Amendment by protecting Americans from gov’t intrusion, which is why I am so happy that this vital legislation passed the House last night. To learn more, watch me speak on the House Floor in support of the Email Privacy Act.
Wishing a Happy Valentine’s Day to my soulmate and best friend, my beautiful wife Jacquie.

“Improving relations with Cuba does not mean that we should discard the claims of the many who have lost their freedoms, their property, or even their loved ones under the brutal Castro regime. However, by engaging with Cuba, we can create new jobs, improve our security, and generate new opportunities for both countries as we work to right the wrongs of the past.”   Learn more about my stance on Cuba by reading my latest op-ed in The Ripon Society, titled Continuing the Shift on Cuba.
This week I spoke on the House Floor to remember the extraordinary life of WCCO radio & Gopher Sports legend Ray Christensen.

Our veterans deserve to be assisted and taken care of by the institutions designated to help them. That’s why this week, the majority of my colleagues and I passed three pieces of legislation that will help our veterans. To learn more, check out my Ask Tom video below.
In honor of President’s Day, check out the video I filmed last year which highlights one of my favorite Presidents.
On Opioid Awareness Day, we must reaffirm our commitment to the fight against drug addiction.
It's a beautiful day to get to work in Minnesota's Sixth District!
Thanks to Legacy Christian Academy for allowing me to read to the kids and visit with your staff. I had a great time!
Thanks to everyone who joined me at my town hall last night! I enjoyed speaking with you all, hearing your feedback, and answering your questions!
Agriculture is a vital industry in Minnesota, so we must work to keep this industry successful. That’s why I am so thankful to everyone who turned out for my Ag listening session today!
I join President Trump’s Commitment to the Renewal of the American Spirit. Read my full release below.

Our veterans are the best that this nation has to offer. Since they have done so much to take care of us, it is vital that we return the favor once they return home. That is why I was so happy to meet with the Disabled American Veterans this morning. They do excellent work serving disabled military veterans and their families, and I have the utmost respect for all that they do. I look forward to working with this excellent group in the 115th Congress.
Happy Birthday to our fearless leader and the world’s best boss! – staff
Wishing a happy birthday to one of the most incredible women in my life, my stunning mother, Patsy! Have a fantastic day Mom, you deserve it!
This week the House GOP released the American Health Care Act. Click on the link below to #Readthebill:

Every year, Senator Franken hosts a hotdish competition with the entire Minnesota delegation. This year my Sunday Beer Run and Brat hotdish came in second to Rep. Collin Peterson's Right to Bear Arms hotdish. It was a blast participating in this great Minnesotan tradition with my colleagues, and I can't wait to bring home the gold next year. If you are interested in trying my hotdish, be sure to check out the recipe below!  emmer.house.gov/sites/emmer.house.gov/files/SundayBeerRunandBratHotdish.pdf

Have your family or business been negatively impacted by Obama’s burdensome regulations and unaccountable Washington bureaucrats? If so, click on the link below and share your financial story with me. We are currently working to rollback burdensome regulations and make agencies accountable to all Americans again, and hearing your personal stories helps ensure that the correct steps are taken.

This week my colleagues and I voted to pass the 2017 Defense Appropriations Bill which will give funds to rebuild our military, enact readiness programs, update critical equipment as well as give our troops a well-deserved raise. To learn more about this bill, and why its passage was necessary, click on my Ask Tom video below.

This week I reintroduced my Financial Stability Oversight Council (FSOC) Reform Act, which will increase oversight, transparency and accountability by subjecting the FSOC to the Congressional Appropriations Process. Learn more about this bill and why it is necessary in my press release below.
A little snow isn’t going to keep my office from being open today. My staff and I are here ready to serve #MN06!

This week, my colleagues and I passed two bills that will ensure our nation’s veterans receive timely, quality care from the institutions designed to help them. Learn more by watching my Ask Tom video below.
Wishing the happiest of birthdays to the best man I know, my father Tom Sr. I love you dad!
On National Agriculture Day, I’m proud to recognize and thank the hardworking individuals who ensure this vital industry’s success.
Wishing the happiest of birthdays to my queen, Jacquie Emmer. Love you forever.

Recent reports have shown that many of our veterans have experienced issues with the Veterans Crisis Line. Our nation’s heroes deserve better and should not have to face long wait times or ignored calls when looking for help. This is why many of my colleagues and I sent a letter to Department of Veterans Affairs Secretary asking that a permanent director be assigned to the Veterans Crisis Line as well as demanding an explanation of how the VA intends to correct this serious issue. To read the full letter that was sent to Secretary Shulkin, click below.

The time for the Congressional Art Competition is once again upon us! If you are a high school student in Minnesota’s Sixth Congressional District, don’t miss out on this incredible opportunity! Learn more below:

Following this week’s House vote on FCC rules and privacy, there has been a lot of misinformation and confusion about what the resolution actually does. Many have expressed concern that their browsing history and internet data is now less secure and private than it was before. However, that is simply not the case. The legislation the House approved rolls back an Obama Administration rule – that had yet to take effect – which took advantage of Americans privacy values and instead empowers agency bureaucrats. It removes duplicative regulation and also takes the government out of the position of picking winners and losers, creating a level playing field for all internet service providers and companies. Telecommunications carriers are still obligated by law to protect confidential customer information, as they have been for over 20 years. Privacy protection, particularly from government intrusion, has been an important priority of mine since taking office.   The bottom line: your information is just as secure today as was last week.

I have always believed that an all-of-the-above energy policy was the best approach to securing our nation’s energy needs. Unfortunately, the last Administration did not share this belief, doing everything possible to promote and implement policies that prevented energy independence, often with overwhelming consequences for families across America. Thankfully, President Trump has chosen to implement a more pragmatic approach to energy. Learn more by watching my Ask Tom video below.
As Women’s History Month comes to an end, be sure to read my latest Medium Post celebrating our nation’s women trailblazers and how we can best honor them.

On the last day of Women’s History Month, I am happy to announce that my office will be hosting the second annual Young Women Leadership Program for Minnesota’s Sixth District. This great program is meant to highlight the amazing achievements of Minnesota women all while inspiring the next generation. To learn more about this excellent program and how to apply, please check out the link below.

Today, I was proud to host the Ox in the Afternoon in my D.C. office for his annual broadcast from the nation’s capital. Huge thanks to Congressman Will Hurd of Texas, Congressman Roger Marshall of Kansas, Congressman Sean Duffy of Wisconsin, Minnesota’s very own Congressmen Collin Peterson and Erik Paulsen, Congressman Brian Babin of Texas and Congressman James Comer of Kentucky for participating. To listen to this exciting broadcast, tune it to KNSI from 2-5 central. http://knsiradio.com/listen-live

This year, my office will once again be hosting a Young Women Leadership Program with events that will take place this summer. This program is designed to highlight the amazing achievements of trailblazing women all while fostering the growth of the women leaders of tomorrow. Last year’s program went incredibly well, and I am looking forward to continued success this year because we have even more excellent women mentors who will have the chance to teach and inspire high school girls who are starting to seriously think about their futures. If you or anyone you know is interested in this exciting opportunity, click below to learn more!

Today, I spoke on the House Floor on behalf of the Supporting America’s Innovators Act. Today’s small businesses are tomorrow’s big businesses, and if our entrepreneurs and business owners are to succeed, then we must remove the roadblocks standing in their way. This legislation will help to do just that by increasing the number of individuals who can invest in and support startups and small businesses across the country. It will help jumpstart capital formation, so that businesses not just survive, but once again thrive. Learn more by watching my speech below.
Judge Neil Gorsuch’s appointment to the United States Supreme Court is a win for the American people. Read my full statement on his confirmation below.

Last week I announced that my office is officially accepting applications for my second annual Young Women Leadership Program. To learn more about this exciting program, designed to inspire young women, check out my video below!

My office is currently accepting applications for our annual Young Women Leadership Program, designed to highlight the accomplishments of Minnesotan women, all while fostering the growth of the women leaders of tomorrow. If you or somebody you know might be interest, click below to learn more.
This morning, Jacquie and I attended our son’s Naval Graduation in Norfolk. I could not be more proud of Petty Officer 3rd Class Joe Emmer.

Tax Day is rapidly approaching which means you may be one of the many Americans scrambling to figure out and complete complicated tax forms built around an archaic and excessive tax code. All with the simple hope that some of your hard-earned money may get returned from the government.    If we are ever going to have an environment where every family and every business has the chance to succeed, we must continue to fight for major reform to our nation’s tax code. Watch my video below to hear more.
Jacquie and I wish you all a happy Easter!

April is Financial Literacy Month, so I joined Affinity Plus Federal Credit Union and visited Rocori District High School students to have a discussion about the importance of fiscal responsibility and planning for your future. As the parent to seven children, many of whom are now adults, I know how imperative it is to emphasize the importance of saving and financial literacy throughout their lifetime. That is why I appreciate the opportunity to work with industry experts to encourage students to look towards their future. Whether you are saving for your education, a house, retirement, or even just vacation, planning and preparation is crucial not just to individual success, but to the success of our nation. To learn more about this visit, click below.

Today I had the chance to visit staff and read to students at the Reach Up Head Start School in St. Cloud. It was such a blast reading “House Mouse, Senate Mouse” to the students and teaching them all about the legislative system. Based off their interest and questions, I think we may have had some future Representatives in the room!

I am proud that my legislation “The U.S. Wants to Compete for a World Expo Act” passed off the House Floor. With this passage, Minnesota, and the United States as a whole, will be one step closer to being able to highlight our innovative spirit and incredible success stories on a global stage. Minnesota is a great state with a lot to offer, and hosting a World’s Fair or Expo is an incredible opportunity to bring people, revenue and tax dollars to Minnesota, all while showing off our state’s natural beauty and incredible people. Additionally, I am proud this bill ensures taxpayer protections at a time when there is so much waste. I am excited that we are closer to realizing the dream of Minnesota hosting the World’s Fair, and I am glad to have the support of the entire Minnesota delegation.

Today, President Trump and his Administration took steps to reform our nation’s out-of-control, archaic, and burdensome tax system and I am very encouraged by his proposal. Learn why by reading my statement below.

Drug abuse is an epidemic that is sweeping the nation, and unfortunately, Minnesota has not been immune. That’s why I encourage you all to participate in National Prescription Drug Take Back Day, which takes place tomorrow. Learn more by watching my video below.

Last year, my office launched a Young Women Leadership Program for high school girls in our district, to help them explore the many different possibilities their future may hold. Due to the success of last year’s program, we will be launching this three series program once again this summer. The Young Women Leadership Program will bring high school girls together with some of the best and brightest professional women in Minnesota, who have expertise in a variety of fields, for the opportunity to learn about different careers, network, develop their own leadership and communication abilities and cultivate skills that they hope to improve upon. Don’t miss out on this exciting opportunity, apply below today.

Today, the House took a big first step in putting the states and the American people back in charge of their health care, by passing the American Health Care Act (AHCA). I am also proud to have supported legislation the House unanimously passed earlier today to ensure Members of Congress and staff are subject to the AHCA as well, because any law that is good enough for the American people is good enough for us. Please read my full release below to see my reasoning for supporting the AHCA.

Just about seven years ago, Americans were promised an end to Washington bailouts, improved consumer protections, and a stronger economy with the passage of Dodd-Frank. Unfortunately, we were all mislead which is why this week I joined my colleagues on the Financial Services Committee to pass the Financial Choice Act. To learn more about how this legislation will roll back the harmful effects of Dodd-Frank, click below to read my statement.

I had a blast visiting Harlan Anderson’s farm in Cokato this morning. It was enlightening to hear all about the day to day work growing alfalfa, as well as learning about his work encouraging young people to take an interest in farming. Farmers like Harlan are such an asset to our community, and we can never thank them enough for everything they do.
On this day in 1858, Minnesota achieved statehood! Happy 159th Birthday to the great North Star State!
Wishing a happy Mother's Day to my beautiful mom Patsy, my lovely wife Jacquie, and to all of the incredible moms out there!

As this week is National Police Week, I decided to speak on the House Floor to celebrate the resiliency of Forest Lake Officer Troy Meyer. Forest Lake is so lucky to have an individual like Troy serving the community.

Yesterday, I reintroduced legislation, The National Interchange/Intersection Safety Construction Program (NIISCP) Act, which would prioritize funding for intersections and interchanges, improve safety, and increase local control over federal transportation dollars. Click below to read my entire press release.

It was such an honor to welcome the MN National Guard’s Bravo Company 2-211th General Support Aviation Battalion home from Afghanistan and thank them for their brave service. It filled my heart with such joy to see these American heroes return safely to their families and loved ones.

I join all Americans in sending our prayers & deepest sympathies to the victims, their families, of last night’s horrific attack. We stand with our friends in the UK and all of her people as we show that unity and compassion can prevail over terror.

Today I took part in a press conference encouraging the enforcement of existing Open Skies Agreements to ensure that U.S. airlines and American workers can compete on a level playing field. Violations to these agreements hurt the United States as a whole, but our state of Minnesota, which is home to international hubs like the Minneapolis/St. Paul Airport gets hit extra hard. I was proud to stand with industry representatives today and take a stand for the American worker!
If you are interested in tuning in to see today's press conference on the need to uphold and honor our Open Skies Agreements, watch below. (My remarks start approximately 2 minutes and 30 seconds in)

It was such a blast having Chrissy from Zimmerman, Minnesota join me for Foster Youth Shadow Day. Once a foster child herself, Chrissy now provides her own foster child with a loving home. It was insightful to hear this incredible woman’s story and learn from her experiences.

The deadline for the Young Women Leadership Program is rapidly approaching. If you a high school girl in #MN06, and want the opportunity to learn from and network with some of Minnesota’s best and brightest professional women, sign up below!
Before you all set out to enjoy Memorial Day Weekend, check out my video highlighting the importance of this holiday!

Today, and every day, we honor the brave men and women of our Armed Forces (and their families) who made the ultimate sacrifice for the nation we all love. I enjoyed participating in Memorial Day events in Sartell and with he St. Cloud VA to celebrate and remember.
Only ten more days to apply to the Young Women Leadership Program! If you are a female high school student in Minnesota’s Sixth District, apply below today!

On the 73rd anniversary of D-Day we must remember the heroes who stormed the beaches of Normandy. President Franklin Delano Roosevelt summed their courage and sacrifice up best. On that day he said that “They fight not for the lust of conquest. They fight to end conquest. They fight to liberate.”
One of my favorite parts of this job is meeting with Minnesotans from all walks of life. Take a look at some of my favorite meetings and moments from the month of May.

Nearly seven years ago, the American people were promised that Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act would end Washington bailouts, protect consumers, and lead to a more prosperous economy. Instead, this disastrous law had the opposite effect. That is why today, I spoke on the House Floor in strong support of the Financial CHOICE Act. Learn more by watching my speech below.

Through Dodd-Frank, the American people were promised an end to Washington bailouts, more protection for consumers and a more prosperous economy. Unfortunately, Dodd-Frank has led to one of the slowest economic recoveries in 80 years, has failed to end bailouts and has enabled the growth of government’s excessive, unnecessary and overreaching regulations harming American entrepreneurs and consumers. While big banks have gotten bigger, our community banks and credit unions – the lifeline of Main Street – are closing up shop, with Minnesota having lost 25 percent of our local financial institutions in the past seven years. Thankfully, today Congress intervened.  Through the passage of the Financial CHOICE Act, we begin to undo the redundant and excessive bureaucratic regulations that are strangling our community banks and credit unions; remove roadblocks stifling our economic success by fostering an increased access to capital for our small business owners and entrepreneurs, and increase Congressional oversight and transparency. Today, our reforms will shift power from Wall Street and Washington bureaucrats, and return it back to Main Street and the American people where it belongs. Full release below.
June is National Dairy Month, which is why this week I was proud to recognize the hardworking Minnesotans who drive our state’s dairy industry.

Last week, I spoke about the importance of protecting funding for the International Affairs Budget. If the United States wants to remain an economic powerhouse and continue to create jobs for hard-working Americans here at home, we must continue to invest in our critical development and diplomacy agencies. If we don’t, our economic competitors certainly will.

Today I had the pleasure of speaking with Minnesota paramedics and had the chance to thank them for providing Minnesotans with excellent care. It was especially a joy to speak with Angie Jarrett, who has recently been awarded the Stars of Life Award from the American Ambulance Association. Angie has gone above an beyond in her job and I could not thank her enough for her service.

Sending sincere prayers to my friend Whip Steve Scalise and all those injured in this morning’s senseless shooting. We are also praying for the officers injured as they worked to protect the innocent Members of Congress, staff, and others present at baseball practice today. Capitol Police work tirelessly to ensure our safety each and every day, and we are so thankful for their bravery. We are grateful they were present to end the attack as swiftly as possible. They are heroes today and always.

Yesterday, I was able to visit with fellows and board members from the Minnesota Excellence in Public Service program. It was great to meet with so many women leaders who have a strong desire to improve the great state of Minnesota and our nation as a whole.

With today’s directive, the Administration is limiting our opportunities to improve the human rights and religious liberties of the Cuban people, not expanding them. This policy decision will hurt the United States economically, making it harder for our nation’s farmers to access new markets and cutting the knees out from under our travel and manufacturing industries. Perhaps most importantly, today’s announcement creates a very real security risk for the American people and our homeland by inviting foreign nations into our backyard to fill a void that today’s announcement is creating.  The voices of our policy makers must represent the voices of the overwhelming majority of Americans who favor improving our relationship with Cuba. I hope as we go forward, the President will remember he was elected to challenge the status quo - not to be part of it.   Read the full release here: https://emmer.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/emmer-presidents-misguided-cuba-directive-undercuts-human-rights

Wishing a happy Father's Day to my wonderful dad who taught me everything I know, and to all the hardworking fathers out there like Jerry Peterson and Ron Samuel! I am also grateful for my seven wonderful children who call me dad!

Yesterday, I had the pleasure of traveling to Northern Minnesota with Congressman Rick Nolan, Congressman Paul Gosar, and Congressman Bruce Westerman to learn about the value of mining to the great state of Minnesota, and to our nation as a whole. After visiting United Taconite in Eveleth to learn about iron ore production, we visited Twin Metals to discuss how future mining projects will bring jobs and revenue to the region. This trip only intensified my support of our hardworking miners, which is why I look forward to working with President Trump to ensure that government gets out of the way so our miners can get back to work!

Today my friend Rabbi Herschel Lutch gave a blessing on the House Floor. Rabbi Latch does great work for the Jewish people across this nation and around the globe, so it was a pleasure to welcome him to the United States Capitol and to recognize his incredible work on the House Floor!

This weekend, we kicked off our 2017 Young Women Leadership Program. I created this program to not only recognize the women leaders across Minnesota, but to also foster the growth of the women leaders of tomorrow. It was such a blast getting to know all of the amazing the girls participating this year, and I look forward to the next two events! I want to thank Rachel Paulose, Kathleen Motzenbecker, and Brigadier General Johanna Clyborn for participating as panelists as well as Kayla Schermer of AST Sports for hosting this event!

It was such a pleasure meeting the new Executive Director of the Minnesota Police and Peace Officers Association, Dave Metusalem. Under his leadership, I know that our state’s law enforcement will continue to protect and serve, and I look forward to working with him in the future.
Take a look at my highlights from the month of June!

Today is a day where instead of the usual disagreements, Americans from all backgrounds, beliefs and lifestyles will come together as a nation to celebrate what we all have in common: That we live in the land of the free and the home of the brave. Happy Independence Day everyone!

ICYMI: Last week, my colleagues and I sent a letter to Secretary of Agriculture Sonny Perdue and Secretary of the Interior Ryan Zinke, urging that President Obama’s disastrous actions on mining in Northern Minnesota be reversed, so that responsible mining can begin again. To learn more about our efforts, check out my press release below:

Had a great time speaking with constituents and answering their questions at the Delano Senior Center this morning. We had very productive discussions about health care, Medicaid and our upcoming agenda in the 115th Congress.
Hard to believe that my sweet daughter is 22 years old today. Happy Birthday Katie!
Thanks to the President of the Minnesota Farm Bureau, Kevin Paap for stopping by my office to discuss how beneficial opening trade with Cuba would be for Minnesota’s agriculture industry!

Sex trafficking is a massive problem in this country, and as the article below demonstrates, Minnesota is not invulnerable. That’s why, today, I will look forward to supporting three pieces of legislation that will give law enforcement the tools and resources necessary to help end sex trafficking once and for all.
I am happy to announce that the House just passed the National Defense Reauthorization Act. To learn why this bipartisan piece of legislation is so important, click on my video below.

Yesterday, I was proud to host a meeting with the Secretary of Agriculture Sonny Perdue to discuss reversing the Obama Administration’s disastrous actions on mining. It is imperative the Trump Administration reverses the previous administration’s last-minute actions to withdraw more than 400,000 acres of land previously designated for resource development. It is time to get government out of the way and to allow our economy to flourish in Northern Minnesota and across the country.

This morning, I accompanied Robert, Dan and Mitchell Teich to the White House. Dan and Robert are brothers, who surprised their father Mitchell, a Vietnam veteran and Purple Heart recipient, with a trip to Washington DC. It is Mitchell’s first time to our nation’s capital, and it was an absolute honor to assist him during his visit to the buildings and monuments that represent his brave service to our great country.

By 2024, it is anticipated the United States will have 1.8 million unfilled tech jobs. This would be detrimental to the future of our state and nation, which is why last week I cosponsored the Championing Apprenticeships for New Careers and Employees in Technology Act, otherwise known as the CHANCE in Tech Act. This critical legislation will help to close the skills gap in the technology sector, ensuring that our great nation remains relevant, successful and globally competitive. Learn more by clicking on the link below!

This weekend, I held the second event of my Young Women Leadership Program. This program is designed to motivate young women in my district to pursue whatever career path inspires them the most as well as help these women to develop their own leadership and communication skills. It was a pleasure to hear from these incredible young ladies again and watch them learn from the amazing women panelists that we invited to participate. Overall, this event was a huge success, and I look forward to holding the third and final portion of this program next month!

I am incredibly proud to announce that my office will be participating in the Congressional App Challenge for the third year in a row. Our nation is currently facing a major skills gap crisis, and if we as a nation are to succeed and remain globally competitive, the generation of tomorrow needs to take an active interest in vital Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEM) skills. I am happy that this challenge presents students in Minnesota’s Sixth District with the opportunity to do just that, and I look forward to seeing what they come up with!
Thirty-one years ago I married the most beautiful woman in the world, and every day since, she has made me the happiest man alive. I love you Jacquie and Happy Anniversary!

Our work to support our nation’s heroes is never complete, which is why last night I was proud to support the Harry W. Colmery Veterans Education Assistance Act of 2017. This bill makes critical reforms to the GI Bill, so our veterans and their families have increased access to valuable training and programs as they seek educational opportunities that match the demands of the modern day workforce. We all know that our nation’s veterans are heroes, and because they do so much to serve us, it is up to us to do the same once they return home. A big part of our service to our vets is helping them to make a smooth transition from active duty to civilian life, and I am happy that this bill will do just that.

Huge thanks to the folks from the Plastics Industry who stopped by my office this afternoon to talk about the skills gap problem facing Minnesota and our nation as a whole, as well as to discuss potential solutions that would get young people interested in these critical manufacturing jobs.

Like all Minnesotans, I believe in preserving and protecting our natural resources and I have no doubt that we can find a way to preserve Minnesota’s pristine landscape without permanently destroying any future job creation or economic development in Minnesota. That’s why I testified today before the Natural Resources Committee regarding my discussion draft on the United States Forest Service’s pending withdrawal application in Northern Minnesota. I am pleased that we took action to get us one step closer to allowing the research and exploration process to proceed, while protecting the potential future economic opportunities in the great state of Minnesota. Check out my statement below!

Yesterday, I was proud to introduce the Advancing and Promoting Programming Act, otherwise known as the APP Act, with my friend and colleague Congressman Peter DeFazio. This legislation will promote app development so that we can officially bring our country into the 21st century and beyond. To learn more about the APP Act does, click on our video below.

This week is American Heroes Week — a time meant to honor the men and women who serve, and have served, our great nation by ensuring our safety, upholding our liberties and fighting for the many freedoms that we hold dear. To read my most recent post, honoring this nation’s veterans, active duty members of our military, police officers, firefighters and first responders, click the link below!

ICYMI: Last week I gave the Congressional Western Caucus' weekly address about taking steps that would allow responsible mining in Northern Minnesota to begin again so that economic opportunity can return to our state!
As July winds to a close, take a look at some of my top moments from this past month!

Yesterday, I had the pleasure of visiting the Minnesota Veterans Home in Minneapolis to learn more about their facility and visit with some of the residents. I was very impressed with the quality of care that our nation’s heroes receive here, and I was happy to have the opportunity to thank the staff for taking such great care of these heroes.
Last night, I had the chance to participate in a great discussion about empowering women entrepreneurs and business owners at the Women 2 Women event in Minneapolis.

Last night, I participated in the 34th Annual National Night Out, an excellent event that aims to strengthen the ties between law enforcement officers and the communities they serve. I enjoyed visiting with Minnesota families in Buffalo!

I love speaking to folks from all over Minnesota’s Sixth District, and this morning, while stopping at a local Caribou, I especially enjoyed a spontaneous conversation about tax reform. In the thirty-one years since the largest tax reform in our nation’s history, our tax code has become overly burdensome. That’s why the time for tax reform is now, so Minnesotans can bring more of their hard-earned money home and so our small businesses can thrive once again.

We all believe in preserving and protecting our natural resources, and I have no doubt we can find a way to preserve Minnesota’s pristine landscape without permanently destroying any future job creation or economic development. To be clear, there is currently no project proposal to mine in the Superior National Forest within the Rainy River watershed. None. Nor does this draft legislation change the law to allow for mining or mineral exploration inside the Boundary Waters Canoe Area or its state and federal buffer zones.  Underground mining can take decades to plan and execute and must be done in accordance with the appropriate environmental and permitting regulations. Our steps today would simply allow for the research and exploration process to proceed. To read more about this proposal, and the extensive environmental process it will protect and leave intact, please read my full op-ed below.

One of the biggest falsehoods that we as a society are telling the generation of tomorrow is that they must attend a four-year university if they expect to thrive and prosper. This well-intended, but misinformed, advice has actually had the opposite effect, leaving many critical jobs unfilled and numerous Americans without the career skills that they need in order to drive our economy forward. That’s why yesterday, I held a Addressing the Skills Gap Summit to discuss potential solutions to this issue. Thanks to everyone who came out and participated.

A huge thanks to all the folks who came out to Minnesota Farm Fest today! Without the hard work and dedication of our farmers, our nation would not have a future, which is why it is imperative that we hear their input and give them a voice. I believe we did just that here today!

This week, I joined some of our nation’s heroes at the Veterans Days of Fishing event hosted by Veteran’s Lake, Inc. It was a fun day filled with fishing, great conversations, and excellent company. I especially appreciated viewing the only monument in Minnesota dedicated to Minnesotan heroes who lost their lives in the War on Terror, located on Veterans Lake.

Enjoyed spending time with Minnesota farmers and industry folks at a meet and greet with Secretary Sonny Perdue this past weekend. I’m glad Secretary Perdue could make it to the North Star State to discuss the issues most important to our farmers. Huge thanks to President of the Minnesota Farm Bureau, Kevin Paap for hosting this awesome event!

Are you a college student interested in a congressional internship? If so, look no further! My office is currently looking for interns to work in either our district or D.C. office during the fall semester. Come join our team by applying below today!
Transportation is a top priority of mine, and vital to Minnesota and our Nation, so today I toured Brenny Transportation in St. Cloud to learn about their trucking services!

There is no question about it: white supremacy is repugnant & has no place in this great nation we call home. We must stand together as one nation against the hatred & racism that attempts to divide us.

It was a pleasure to have Jori and Dan visit my district office today with their son Elliott who was adopted from China. Jori and Dan hit many roadblocks during the adoption process, and I am so proud my office and our excellent caseworkers could help them bring Eliott home. Welcome to Minnesota, Eliott!

I had a great time at the COP House in St. Cloud this afternoon! This house is the key to connecting police with the community they serve! I even was able to squeeze in a little time for soccer with some St. Cloud kids!

This past weekend, we wrapped up our last event of the Young Women Leadership Program. It was a successful event and we really appreciate all who participated, especially this week’s host, Annie Deckert. This summer’s Young Women Leadership Program was a massive success, so much so, that I am already looking forward to next year’s program!

Are you a college student looking for valuable work experience? If so, look no further! My office is currently looking to hire interns for the fall semester to assist our staff with a variety of tasks. Click the following link to learn more and apply today!

Constituent services are an important part of what my office does on a daily basis. If you are having trouble navigating a federal agency, you are in luck. As the aftermath of Hurricane Harvey unfolds, it is going to be more vital than ever to reform the National Flood Insurance Program. The NFIP is an program under FEMA responsible for providing insurance for properties in risk of flooding. Unfortunately, this program is nearly $25 billion in debt and has not been performing to the best of its ability.    This is an issue that does not just affect coastal states like Texas. As the land of 10,000 lakes, Minnesota has more shoreline than Florida, California and Hawaii combined, making flood insurance a must for many homeowners in our state. If you are a Minnesotan who has had issues with the National Flood Insurance Program and would like to see reform, please click the following link in order to share your story.

Wishing my son Bobby a very happy birthday today. He is starting off his 25th year as a newly married man!
Wishing a Happy Labor Day to all the members of this nation’s incredible workforce.
Don’t forget, tomorrow my staff will be holding mobile office hours in Anoka County. Be sure to stop by if you are having issues with a federal agency!

I had a great time working in the district this August! It was a pleasure meeting with Minnesotans from all walks of life and hearing their stories. Be sure to take a look at my highlights from this month!

I am disappointed in Senator Franken’s decision to oppose the nomination of Justice David Stras to the Eighth Circuit Court of Appeals. Justice Stras is one of the nation’s premier legal minds in the areas of federal courts, constitutional law, and in his own words, the ‘proper, limited role of the judiciary.’ It is because of these traits, that Justice Stras’ nomination to the Eighth Circuit Court of Appeals garnered immense support from both sides of the aisle. I am disheartened that Senator Franken has chosen to obstruct this lengthy process so early, and deeply concerned that the seat could now go to someone less qualified and from outside of Minnesota. I call on Senator Franken to reconsider his obstruction of the full consideration of Justice Stras.

We will never forget the Americans we lost and the heroism of our first responders on September 11, 2001.

This morning I had the opportunity to help the USO put together care packages for our military members who are currently helping with rescue and relief efforts in states that have been effected by Hurricane Harvey and Irma. While we cannot thank our military members enough for their critical work in assisting these folks who so desperately need help, I hope that these packages let them know just how grateful we are.
Wishing a very happy 26th birthday to my second born! Jack, I hope this next year is filled with success, happiness and lasting memories!

Fashion sure has changed since 1986, but unfortunately, our tax code has not. That is why House Republicans have come up with a fair and simple tax plan, so that hardworking Americans can thrive once again!

Today I had the chance to catch up with Jori and Dan Susanka, who were named Angels in Adoption honorees this year after they adopted their son Elliot from China. Every child deserves a home, so I was glad to see the Susanka family recognized for giving Elliot a loving home and happy childhood.
Small businesses are the backbone of our economy, so we must help them prosper and thrive. Our new fair and simple tax plan will help to do just that!
After 31 years, Congress finally has a plan to reform our nation’s tax code by putting middle class families and the American worker first! Learn more by clicking my press release below!
September is Suicide Prevention Month, so as this month draws to a close, I wanted to talk to you specifically about veteran suicide and what steps we can take to prevent this type of tragedy.
Today, I introduced the MINER Act, which will help restore mineral rights to Minnesota, so that our miners, the state of Minnesota, and our nation can once again thrive.

Yesterday, I spoke at the Financial Services Full Committee Markup in support of my Home Mortgage Disclosure Adjustment Act, which will provide essential regulatory relief for our community banks and credit unions, so that they can better provide the capital that small businesses and families need to survive! Learn more about this important legislation below.

During the Financial Services Full Committee Markup, I also spoke about my Micro Offering Safe Harbor Act, which will help small businesses raise capital. Small businesses are the backbone of our economy as they account for two thirds of all new jobs, which is why I am glad to introduce a bill that will allow our small businesses to grow and thrive.

Last week, I introduced Minnesota’s Economic Rights (MINER) in the Superior National Forest Act, which will help restore mineral rights to Minnesota so that our miners, the state of Minnesota, and nation can once again thrive. There has been some misinformation going around about this bill, so this week, I wanted to take a little time to explain this bill further, talk about why it matters, and to clear up any falsehoods about it. To hear my message on the MINER Act, click on my message below.

I was very disappointed to read the disparaging comments from the Save the Boundary Waters leaders against miners and union workers in Northern Minnesota. This nation was built on the backs of the American worker, and Minnesota was built on the backs of Minnesota miners. The next time the Save the Boundary Waters leaders voice their opposition, I hope they take into account how much the mining industry and miners have provided us over the years

Yesterday, we hosted a series of roundtables to meet with local elected officials, manufacturers, small business owners, accountants and financial services professionals to hear what tax reform means to them and what they hope to see included as Congress works toward fixing our broken tax code.
ICYMI: Last week, I wrote an open letter to Amazon as to why they should place their new headquarters in the great state of Minnesota!

Today, President Trump declared the opioid crisis a nationwide public health emergency. Unfortunately, like many Americans, I know the devastation opioid addiction leaves in its wake. This horrific disease knows no bounds. It does not discriminate due to age, education or wealth, and it even happens in small town Minnesota. To hear more, please watch my remarks at Hazelden’s Pain.Pill.Problem Summit.

In the technology driven world we live in, STEM skills will continue to grow more important. That’s why every year my office participates in the Congressional App Challenge! In an effort to engage students throughout the 6th Congressional District, we participate in this districtwide competition centered around app development. The deadline for students to submit their apps for this year’s competition is this Wednesday, November 1st at 11am CST. If you’ve been working on an app, but haven’t registered yet, please visit: https://goo.gl/aXBKCx. If you’ve already registered, be sure to submit your app by Wednesday’s deadline!

It's a big weekend in Minnesota! Wishing all a safe and productive deer opener!

This past weekend I was proud to join the celebration to honor Major General Nash for his service as Adjutant General of the Minnesota National Guard. We must recognize his service to the State of Minnesota for what it is, true passion and dedication to the safety and security of this great state. Our thriving National Guard is a testament to his legacy as Adjutant General. For the past seven years, Major General Nash has exemplified what true leadership looks like in action, as he led the nearly 11,000 men and women that make up our National Guard. We were more than lucky to have him. Thank you, Major General Nash!

Today, my bipartisan MINER Act passed the House Committee on Natural Resources. I am proud that we are one-step closer to restoring Minnesota’s mineral rights. The passage of this legislation will ensure Minnesotans will have a say in what happens in their backyard. Overreach from the Federal Government has caused Northern Minnesota to suffer economic stagnation for far too long. Environmentally responsible mining is possible, and we can preserve our beautiful state while also growing our local economy. Click here to learn more: https://goo.gl/yGnJLF

Small business owners and entrepreneurs are the backbone of our society, and responsible for more than half of new jobs created each year. It is important we pass necessary reforms so that these job creators can grow, prosper and achieve the American Dream. I am proud my legislation to clarify existing law so that small businesses and startups have more ways to access capital passed through the House today.  https://goo.gl/9dXXMP

This week was a productive one in Washington, as the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act passed out of the Ways and Means committee, my MINER Act was passed through the House Committee on Natural Resources, and my Micro Offering Safe Harbor Act earned support by the majority of my colleagues and was passed off the House Floor! It is weeks like this one that I am reminded that the work we are doing here in Washington will bring a better tomorrow for future generations. To learn more about this week’s activities, watch my video here:

Today, we must take the time to thank those that served in our armed forces. Without them, we would not know true freedom. The sacrifice of our veterans and their families is endless, and we must recognize their selflessness. Which is why, I dedicated this week’s video to them, click here to watch:

This past weekend, I was honored to be able to thank so many veterans and their families at Veterans Day ceremonies across Minnesota. Their service and sacrifice to this great nation should always be recognized. I am humbled to represent some of these brave men and women in Congress, and I am so glad I was able to thank them in person. We must always take the time to thank our heroes.
On Wednesday, the host location of Expo 2023 will be announced, watch my floor speech in support of bringing this prestigious international exhibit home to the great state of Minnesota!

I am proud to join my colleagues in the House to pass common-sense legislation to reauthorize and reform our National Flood Insurance Program (NFIP). The 21st Century Flood Reform Act, extends the program's authorization for another five years while incorporating reforms which lay the groundwork for a private flood insurance marketplace to take hold. While there is more to be done to bring the NFIP out of debt and improve the way it operates, the reforms included in this legislation take important steps to better prepare policyholders for future disasters. I am glad we are looking to the future to prevent Congress from being forced to continue governing from crisis to crisis.

Because of lack of action by the Senate, Minnesota has already been forced to find alternative funding in order to continue coverage for CHIP recipients. What’s even worse, despite the state’s efforts to ensure we do not leave pregnant women in the lurch, Minnesota will be penalized.   I am proud to introduce legislation to allow Minnesota more flexibility to continue providing coverage for children and pregnant mothers while we wait for the Senate to pass legislation reauthorizing CHIP. Click below to read more. https://goo.gl/WU5hGw

Today is a historic day for middle-class families and Main Street Minnesota. I am proud to support the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act. This legislation puts middle-class families first by doubling the standard deduction, increasing the Child Tax Credit, retaining the Adoption Tax Credit, and ultimately lowering tax rates for 99% of Americans.   This is just the beginning and I look forward to working with my counterparts in the Senate to create a final product that will serve the needs of all Americans! Read my full statement below: https://goo.gl/3nQwnY

Thousands of kids across the country are searching for a forever family. My staff and I are proud to have helped numerous MN families in their quest toward adoption. Join me in spreading the joys of adoption on National Adoption Day. Read more here: https://goo.gl/qGyt6w
I can’t believe my youngest is 16 years old today! Happy birthday Johnny!

Last week, I was proud to vote for the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act because it will bring relief for Americans all across this nation. I was also pleased the Adoption Tax Credit was included. During National Adoption Awareness Month, we must remember the importance of finding forever families for kids in need!

Happy Thanksgiving to you and your family! Thanksgiving is a time to celebrate the blessings of the year. From the farmers who brought in a bountiful harvest to the families who are spending the day together, it is a time to find a reason to be thankful. As always, I am thankful for my family, my friends and the opportunity to represent all of you. I hope you have a safe and happy Thanksgiving day.

Today is Small Business Saturday! I hope you’ll take the time today to stop at your favorite neighborhood small business. These businesses are the lifeblood of our community, and we should always remember their contributions to the success of our economy. If you can, please take the time to support the small businesses in your area!

Grateful for the support of Range Association of Municipalities and Schools, United Brotherhood of Carpenters, Jobs for Minnesotans on our MINER Act. Read their op-ed “We Can Mine Responsibly. Restore our Rights” below:

By passing the MINER Act today, we are protecting more than ten thousand jobs and billions of dollars in revenue and education funding, while leaving an extensive process intact to protect and preserve the environment and our state.
I had a wonderful evening with my beautiful wife Jacquie last night at the White House Congressional Ball!

In 2009, Congress proclaimed each December 6 as National Miner’s Day to honor the brave men and women and their hard work over the past 100+ years. The raw materials in our iPhones, computers, cars, wind turbines, solar panels, heating and cooling systems and other everyday products are a result of the work of miners. This National Miners Day, I’m grateful that the House passed the MINER Act to allow miners’ good work to continue.
NA

Last week, Congressman Ryan Costello and I introduced the CHIP Stability Act – a stopgap funding bill which was included in this week’s continuing resolution. This legislation allows for CHIP to be funded through the end of the year and bring certainty and much needed support for thousands of Minnesotans. I am proud to be a voice for the individuals who depend on CHIP and will continue to fight on behalf of Minnesota families.

Nearly 150 youth are experiencing homelessness on any given night in the greater St. Cloud area. Encouraged to see local rotary clubs team up with Anoka’s Hope 4 Youth to open “Pathways 4 Youth” – the center will provide food, clothing, showers, laundry, lockers, and a mailing address, as well as social services and medical professionals, for these young Minnesotans. The center will open in February. Read more here:

Congress has held over 110 hearings and markups while reforming our outdated tax code. And today, in the continued spirit of transparency, there will be another opportunity to follow our progress on the Tax Cuts & Jobs Act. Watch the open meeting live here at 1PM CT: speaker.gov/live

Since our founding, America has stood as a shining city upon a hill whose beacon light guides freedom-loving people everywhere. Yesterday the House capitalized on an opportunity to further that role, by passing the Iranian Leadership Asset Transparency Act (H.R. 1638), which would help expose corrupt officials in Iran, the world’s foremost state sponsor of terrorism. I took to the House floor in support of this bill – watch my full speech below:

My office has participated in the Congressional App Challenge since its inception three years ago. This challenge aims to encourage middle and high school students from all over the nation to develop their own software application, otherwise known as an app. This is an effort to encourage students throughout the country to learn coding and STEM skills. I am glad that students across my district are learning and practicing these important skills! And, I want to again congratulate this year’s winning team: Jessica Tober, Erika Mork, Ella Mork and Samantha Pieper from Central Middle School in Norwood Young America. Minnesotans like these young women are what make our great State what it is - innovative, forward-thinking and creative!

My colleague Representative Hultgren and I just introduced legislation to provide relief to Main Street banks so that they can focus on getting Americans into new homes in a timely manner rather than figuring out how to navigate through more red tape. Burdensome regulations have made it impossible for small businesses and community banks to succeed – yet they are the lifeblood of our nation’s economy. We must do what we can to ensure they thrive. Learn more about the Home Mortgage Reporting Relief Act here: https://emmer.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/reps-emmer-hultgren-stand-small-businesses-and-community-banks-introduce

Today I supported lowering individual taxes, expanding the child tax credit, doubling the standard deduction, providing relief from the Death Tax, and letting businesses create opportunities for millions across the country. This once-in-a-generation tax reform package is a major victory for Minnesotans and Americans across the country. Read my full statement on the House passage of the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act here:

Community health centers play a critical role in Minnesota by providing quality, patient-centered medical, dental and behavioral health care services. They are especially vital in remote, rural areas of the state. Had a great discussion with Minnesota Association of Community Health Centers - MNACHC, Open Cities Health Center, and Scenic Rivers Health Services on the importance of their role our local communities. Funding for these centers is crucial. I was proud to support the Championing Healthy Kid’s Act - a long-term solution for community health centers and Minnesotans who rely on CHIP - which the House passed in November and now awaits action in the Senate.

I am always inspired by my fellow Minnesotans. This is yet another example of the way our communities come together to care for one another. This holiday season, veterans, their families and people in need all across Minnesota’s 6th District can count on their neighbors. It’s an honor to serve such selfless and compassionate people.
Happy 21st birthday to my son Joe! Wishing you a memorable day and a wonderful year ahead!

Our heavy hearts are with the friends and family of fallen Captain Jeff Vollmer and the entire Mayer Fire Department. Minnesota is grateful for his incredible 12 years of service to protect our community.

ICYMI: CBS This Morning asked three families for their tax returns. While each family believed they would pay more under the new plan, they were (happily) surprised to discover that they would in fact pay less. Read here:
Jacquie and I wish you a Merry Christmas! May you find comfort in family and friends this holiday season.

The Wall Street Journal  highlights: “Of America’s 1,980 rural counties, 625 don’t have a locally owned community banks” and “at least 35 counties have no bank.” With rural lending below 1996 levels, now more than ever, we must continue to provide relief to Main Street banks and credit unions. The House Committee on Financial Services has been committed to this goal by passing the Financial CHOICE Act and rolling back burdensome regulations that would continue the decline of rural lending and force smaller players to close up shop. We will continue this commitment into 2018, putting Main Street first and empowering small businesses in Minnesota across America.

Today, I stopped in Downtown Elk River at Olde Main Eatery for a quick bite and had a great conversation with the owner Greg! I shared with him what we’re doing in Washington to help small businesses thrive in #MN06!

It’s been an incredible year serving you in Congress. From helping Minnesotans with federal agencies to holding meetings on the issues that are most important to you, to passing bills in the House and everything in between, together we have accomplished so much. Thank you for the honor of serving #MN06 in Congress. To keep up with what we’re doing in the New Year, sign up for my newsletter here: https://emmer.house.gov/contact/newsletter
